We will provide meals once again, on Tuesday, April 7th beginning at 11:00 a.m. at Davidson Middle School in the parking lot off Trenton Road. We will continue until while supplies last or 1:00 p.m.

Stay healthy and stay Safe!

Jill Pastor
Superintendent

I know that many clubs in Southgate are completing their community service projects at this time. I wanted to take a moment to put a spotlight on Southgate's DECA group.

DECA purchased Christmas cards and had students write thank you notes inside to the Southgate Fire and Police Departments. We purchased donuts for each department and delivered the donuts with the cards.

The group collected and cashed in bottles and cans and donated nearly $400 to the Southgate Animal Shelter.

They collected dry and canned foods and delivered them to the food pantry at Asher.

This morning at 7:00am the DECA group made 10 twin size tie blankets for the Shriners, which will be given to the sick children.

Allen Elementary has received some new play areas for their kindergarten, young fives, and preschoolers! This fall Mrs. Noble acquired some hand-me-down plastic play houses for the kids to enjoy next to their little slide. The children loved them so much Mrs. Vasich reached out to her classroom parents and mentioned that if anyone else had playhouses they no longer needed we would be excited to have more. Allen received something better than hand-me-downs - three adorable NEWLY built houses and now the ‘littles’ have their own ‘little’ village!

Allen would like to give a big heartfelt thank you to Brian and Ximena Munoz (Allen students) and their parents (who thought of creating some from scratch). Brian and Ximena’s parents (Adriana Aviles-Rodriguez and Martin Munoz) own Munoz Realty and MP Services (which demolishes and cleans out buildings, snakes out drains, contracts and fixes up houses).

Athletes who played at least three varsity sports all in the same school year received the honor. Athletes may earn this award once in their career, but some have carried this distinction for multiple years. This is the third year this award has been in place in the Downriver League. Receiving this year's award are Brandon Payne, junior (left), Malia Borg, senior, Cole Hinzmann, junior, Kylie Smith, sophomore, and Jordan Hunt, sophomore.
